meanings.definition: Relating to or characteristic of a university professor
meanings.sent1: Her donnish attire and serious demeanor made her stand out among the students.
meanings.sent2: The professor's donnish lectures were always filled with insightful information.
meanings.sent3: The donnish professor accidentally showed up to class wearing mismatched socks.
meanings.sent4: His donnish way of speaking made even the most complex topics easy to understand.
meanings.sent5: The donnish aura of the library inspired a love for learning in all who entered.

meanings.definition: Scholarly or pedantic in manner or attitude
meanings.sent1: His donnish behavior often annoyed his classmates who preferred a more casual approach.
meanings.sent2: The author's donnish writing style was admired by literary critics.
meanings.sent3: The donnish scholar insisted on using Latin phrases in everyday conversations.
meanings.sent4: She had a donnish obsession with grammar, correcting everyone's speech constantly.
meanings.sent5: The donnish tone of the debate made it difficult for others to participate.
